section.title: Overview
section.para: This chapter will explain the model that is essential for every MyAdmin based application. Starting with a basic model that will be extended step by step to show new features until it meets all requirements for the demo project.

This basic (and completely useless) model only consists of the model name Demo and an empty package. The model name is typically used when referencing the model in MWE Workflows. This model also defines an empty package de.pellepelster.myadmin.demo, as this is the topmost package it will automatically be used as root package path. So for this model all generated Java artifacts will be located somewhere under de.pellepelster.myadmin.demo.*.

listitem.para: Model ID's Each model element has its own unique ID, e.g. the ID for an entity is it's name, for an attribute it's the name of the attribute, etc. Because nearly all elements of the model will later result in some sort of generated java source code, model identifiers should comply to the rules for Java identifiers, to avoid compile time problems.

section.title: Entities
section.para: Entities basically consist of a name and a list of attributes, with each attribute having it's own type. The definition resembles a Java class definition with the difference that the attributes type is preceded with the keyword datatype meaning that this attribute should take its type information from the datatype CountryName.

formalpara.title: Entity without datatypes

section.para:
If you only need an entity without a UI without the overhead of defining datatypes you can use the keyword simpletype followed by one of the following types:
Long
Integer
BigDecimal
String
Boolean
Reference
